With the volume of people visiting they have done a very good job of moving people around. We all had a great time, hope these tips help.

I'm a life-long Disney parks fan (been to Disney World eleven times, Disneyland Paris one time, and Disneyland CA one time). But this past trip to Disneyland left much to be desired. If a theme park is open and charging high prices for a multi-day ticket, then they should be providing a full range of activities and entertainment. On the day we went (Jan 10, 2024), Disneyland had no shows on their schedule, no parades during the day, and no fireworks at night. Not to mention It's a Small World, Astro Orbiter, and the Mark Twain Riverboat were closed. Genie+ is necessary in order to gain quick access to the more popular rides. Although not all rides are included on it (so take note of that before you buy it). You do have to be tied to your smartphone in order to take full advantage of Genie+ (like constantly looking at the app and refreshing wait times to get a good time you want).We waited around 35 minutes to pay for parking (this was 9AM on a Wednesday). Parking attendants were chatting to themselves and not directing cars. Getting into the park was fine, but no hard tickets are offered anymore (the excuse of going "all digital"). Some people don't want to use their phone for every Lightning Lane entrance. So why is it impossible to give use cards to use for this purpose? I last went to Disney World in 2020 and they still gave us cards. Luckily, I had printed out our tickets so luckily we could fold each paper into a shape that displayed the barcode for the LL entrances. Now onto comparing DL to WDW (specifically, Magic Kingdom): DL is much more cramped, crowded, and thus unpleasant. There were times when I couldn't see the pavement ahead of me while walking. Tomorrowland was laughably overrun by what looked like hundreds of strollers being parked on the main path. I couldn't really tell where each land began and the other ended. Frontierland consisted of Big Thunder Mountain Railroad and... what else? Critter Country was lifeless (construction of Tiana's Bayou Adventure took over the whole land). Though I enjoyed Pooh's Corner candy store (get the Mickey Rice Krispies treat & peanut butter sandwich). Galaxy's Edge was ugly (sorry not sorry). And what's going on with the rides that keep closing throughout the day? It's a major time-suck to keep checking the app to see, for example, if Runaway Railway is closed or not. One major observation: the castle looked weird with all the fake snow decorations covering it. Also, the cast members had a generally fake, disinterested vibe as well. None were very enthusiastic about doing their jobs. Going to Disneyland honestly just made me wish I had booked a trip to Disney World instead. People who think DL is better must have some internal bias/local pride going on. Looking forward to going back to Florida for more space, MANY more options for entertainment, and an overall much better vacation vibe!

Was quite disappointing as we spent most of the 2 days waiting in lines which were 1 1/2 hours long, this is not a great experience with young children.we came all the way from Australia and only got to ride on a few rides, paid $1500 to wait in queues for 2 days :(
We had a great time, but, the Genie Plus was of questionable value.  Overall worse than express pass, but we love Disney.  Queues were not good.

Also love Disneyland but they‚Äôre just lacking a bit of their magic at the moment. I mean the place is iconic and soooo much thought and details areIncluded into everything, but maybe the staff is dealing with a bit of post Covid handover. They‚Äôre all masked up and not as interactive with the guests as they used to be. Also numerous rides were down through out the day. It could have just been our visit and they were quick to bring back.Regardless of an average score, Disney is always a great destination to hit up.

Don‚Äôt go unless you buy the fast lane pass. Anyone in the fast lane has full priority over the standby lane on most rides. Pay the extra or don‚Äôt plan to take popular rides. Don‚Äôt trust the line wait signs. If the fast lane line fills, the standby lane stops.

Disneyland continues to deteriorate while raising ticket prices.  One ride is under construction and three major rides (pirates of the Caribbean, Matterhorn and rise of the resistance) stopped due to malfunction‚Ä¶.some after waiting inline for more than 45 minutes.  Firework was cancelled due to wind conditions.  Even though they have less rides available they still admit and sell pricey tickets to large number of visitors causing excessive waiting times. . This visit wins the worst time in Disneyland over more than 40 years of coming to this park.  I hope Disneyland management can stop this deterioration and restore the good old smooth, pleasant and efficient environment.

Our Disneyland dream finale morphed into a nightmare. Although a park employee had seen us in our location for over an hour, he decided to start to remove us when the darkness for the fireworks already began. The sudden descent into darkness for the fireworks show triggered a chaotic evacuation. Blinding strobe lights and blaring announcements left my son trembling in fear, navigating treacherous steps with only fleeting flashlight flashes as guides. This, on our last precious evening at the happiest place on earth, was meant to be a magical memory, not the source of my son's tearful pronouncement: "That was the worst day of my life." The promised spectacle fizzled into a terrifying scramble, leaving a sour note at the end of our otherwise joyful trip.After four months of waiting, all we got was an apology.

We have been Disneyland passholders on and off for the last ten years and while we have always loved so many things about Disney it just feels like costs have skyrocketed and the quality of the experience has really slipped in terms of what you get for your money.  The prices are out of control, lines longer than ever, frequent ride closures/breakdowns, Lightening Lane is a total scam.  Yesterday we got stuck at the very top of the Incredicoaster - it was the first ride we did for the day just after we paid for Lightening Lane. We had to wait almost 30 minutes to get unhooked by maintenance and walk the entire way down from 120 feet in the air on a very steep & scary staircase with nothing but a little railing to hold onto - it was open below the railing and to the track side of the coaster.  The cast was very nice and helpful, but they also acted like it was no big deal (almost seemed like it happens all the time) and all they gave us as compensation was one measly "multiple experiences pass" that was good on "some" rides (so obviously all of the most popular rides are excluded). My kids were freaked out by it and did not want to do anymore rides after that which was understandable so we just ate dinner and left.  I called customer service today to ask if they could at least refund our Lightening Lane passes that we had bought only one hour before this ride broke down on us since it was our first & only ride of the day we didn't even get to use the LL passes.  The cast member was adamant that "Lightening Lane passes are non-refundable" and that it was part of the "agreement" we made when purchasing them.  It just feels so gross and skeezy that after years of spending money on passes, food, parking, merch etc ... they wouldn't even refund me a meager $73 because their product malfunctioned.  Very few other businesses could ever get away with that.  It seems they know that people will still come here because of the nostalgia and wanting to make their kids happy so they don't care about the value of your experience as long as they get your money.  Corporate greed masquerading as "magical".

I used to be an AP holder. I let that expire and had not been to the park in 7 years. Only went for my son's birthday. This is not the park I remember. I used the Genie+ since we were only there for the 1 day. I do not like that I can only use it once a day per ride. So no doing a LL for HM twice in 1 day. I also didn't like having to set a reminder to check to secure the next LL. The crowds were not as bad as I thought they would be. Some stuff doesn't change. Alice in Wonderland ride always has a crazy wait time. Was not enjoyable being there like it used to be.

The new "Galaxy's Edge" area us truly awesome, really makes you feel like you're in the fabled "galaxy far, far away". BUT...do not WASTE MONEY on GENIE PLUS (their new 'fastpass' system)! It's basically a scam! Many cool rides ARE NOT part of GENIE Plus (ie: Rise of the Resistance), and you can ONLY book something with it EVERY 2 HOURS ONLY!  And then...even the rides that are part of Genie Plus are blocked from it later in afternoon or evening!!! Ridiculous! Better to wait till night time during parade hour or fireworks hour to ride popular rides like Indiana Jones, etc.

The original Disneyland that's a must visit with rides and gifts at it best pricing. Genie+ (express lane) is a must buy for tourist unless 2-3ride a day is what u expect in the most happiest place on earth experience is. Stawar ride is like 90min and u need topup USD26/pax to skip the qeue on top of genie+
Gennie fast pass it‚Äôs a bad joke! Not a fast pass! You need to apply for each attraction! i want my money back @disney!

The Holiday season at Disneyland is always a magical time and we recently got a chance to experience the park in its entire Holiday splendor. We had not had the chance to visit the park during the holidays since before the pandemic and have recently made up for lost time with three visits this year to go along with our Halloween event covering during the D23 Expo last year.We arrived just before opening and made sure to take pictures of the tree as well as great decorations and the castle as we made our way to breakfast before heading to Star Wars Galaxy‚Äôs Edge to enjoy Rise of the Resistance and Smuggler‚Äôs Run. My wife had never experienced either on our prior visits and it was great to see her enjoying the special attractions as well as the amazing shops and scenery of the land.As always we were impressed by the amazing attention to detail from the worn look of the Resistance Gear to the sheen of the First Order technology.Our afternoon included a visit to Big Thunder Mountain, and the DVC Member Lounge but we also took in Mickey and Minnie‚Äôs Runaway Railroad with all the amazing memorabilia as well as classics like Peter Pan and Sleeping Beauty.A highlight of this visit was getting on Indiana Jones and the Temple of the Forbidden Eye. We had not been able to experience it since the updates have been added and the enhanced optics and improvements took this classic to a new level.As evening arrived we made sure to catch the holiday parade which was a dazzling mix of color, music, and lights. We had caught some of it during the day but made sure to watch the evening show as that is where it really shined.A night voyage on the Jungle Cruise followed along with a visit to the Haunted Mansion which was sadly down when we came to visit. Thankfully we enjoyed the Pirates of the Caribbean and exited to find a very heavy downpour which soon had water pooling up and guests fleeing for the exits. We attempted to wait it out but sadly had to cut our visit shorter than we planned but still had an amazing time and were able to enjoy the spectacular lights and music as the park transformed in the evening and we made sure to visit several shops to take in the many items available.I booked a visit over my wife‚Äôs birthday in 2024 to visit the new DVC Villas at the Disneyland hotel and we look forward to more magic in the coming year and beyond especially with our next Disney Cruise scheduled for March.Reservations are required at the parks and guests will also want to make sure to visit California Adventure for more Holiday Magic as well.

We enjoyed our day at Disneyland and didn't really have issues with queues as we paid extra for the Geinie pass and planned our day.All rides were working although one did break down temporarily due to some idiot standing up and a sensor got damaged.Food is as expected overpriced, as are the souvenirs.We stayed for the fireworks, but left the park for about 90 minutes to have dinner at one of the restaurants outside the park. We paid $12 - $15 for pizzas rather than paying $5 per slice in the park.Unfortunately, we did not get a good spot for the fireworks and a tree blocked our view of all fireworks on the left side, but it was still a nice show.Parking is off site, about a 5 min shuttle bus (provided) ride away.

December 14-15, 2023zCouple broken rides. Waited in line for awhile then got the announcement that it‚Äôs having malfunction which wasted our time. We waited for the Fireworks show in Disneyland Park and they gave us the excuse of ‚Äúdue to wind, they won‚Äôt be doing the fireworks show‚Äù. But was the wind really the problem? There is a flag on top of the castle and the flag was not moving whatsoever so why would they say they can‚Äôt continue with the fireworks because of the wind? Tons of people was disappointed. Not really a great experience especially when spending $320 each head.

Well a first time for all three of us. We were stoked. After all it is supposed to be to be a place for all. We were pleasantly surprised that most stores had the capability to fit wheelchairs through. Some were not as wide. We were disappointed at the lack of characters we saw. We thought they would be out and about meeting people. They also didn‚Äôt have the parades we thought they were supposed to have. I have two people on oxygen and I was told there are outlets everywhere, that is not true. The ones they have are too powerful because it‚Äôs for the food carts and cleaners. We were hoping to charge while we ate, but that was not possible. We were directed to the first aide center to charge. They were more than happy to have us charge there, but it‚Äôs time wasted for us. I noticed first aide, and the bathrooms are not clearly marked. The maps were not helpful. It seems like so much was hidden and not clearly marked. It was hard to find a cast member to help with our questions. The ones we did find were very friendly‚Ä¶ with the exception of a few. We were able to successfully ride two rides as a family. The Haunted Mansion they are able to have you ride the scooter right to the ride and pick up right after. However, the ramp in and out of the mansion is on the narrow side. So it can be difficult to fit two wheelchairs through. The cast members really go about and beyond to help you on and off. The Jungle cruise you can ride the scooter/wheelchair right on it as they have a lift. The Pirates of the Caribbean is not really made for that. As it is a good step in and out. And, when coming to the end of the ride, it‚Äôs like bumper cars. The boats aren‚Äôt controlled enough to not hit each other. At night in Adventure land and Frontierland, are super dark. I don‚Äôt have issues seeing, but I had issues seeing. There are many hills in there, so it can be a workout for those pushing wheels chairs or strollers. There are improvements that need to be made to make the experience better for more. There needs to be better maps and signage. More room for those with disabilities so they can enjoy things with their families. More visible cast members and characters. Plugs need to be made available for those who need to charge oxygen. We did have a great time, and we were happy to experience some rides together due to amazing accommodations. The staff was wonderful in not making you feel like you have a disability. We may come back again.For those going to Disney Bring back up chargersPlan ahead and try to find where you want to go to avoid wasting timeNeed a Scooter - one a across the street has after hours drop off

We did a two day visit on a hopper ticket with genie+ to both Disneyland and California Adventure Park. Be aware the Genie+ has time restrictions and only seems to allow 1 lightening ride every 3 hours! The parks were both great fun.Our major disappointment was both nights the fireworks were cancelled.
The park was BEYOND overcrowded with waits of 90 minutes and plus, and broken rides. Not a very magical experience, unfortunately.

Went for the annual candlelight ceremony. It was festive and beautiful as always. Ticket deal through Target was worth the cost of buying an additional ticket so I could go on a date my Magic Key is blocked.

When Disneyland and California adventure work you can have a lot of fun. If you do your homework, have a lot of patience and are flexible, you can work around some of the issues. Different approaches are going to work for different people.     Our recent three day trip to Disneyland was marred by many problems: The parks were hopelessly crowded at times; wait times for a few of the  most popular rides exceeding 2 hours. Some of the major rides never operated during our stay, others were up and down throughout every day with the result that one could wait in  line for long periods only to have the ride go down, requiring patrons to go somewhere else. Runaway Railway was the worst, being inoperable more than it was operable.      The current ticketing system is complicated and expensive. The Disneyland App inexplicably dropped one of our tickets from the system, requiring us to spend two hours at the ticket office and then at Guest Services dealing with employees who acted like they were doing us a favor by even talking to  us. The app itself is another problem as we spent our days avoiding patrons who were walking around staring at their cell phones attempting to find a ride that was open rather than looking where they were going.     Food was expensive and mediocre. Entrees arrived pre-cooked, re-heated and barely warm, of questionable quality. Don't waste your time and money on the character breakfast. The characters were few and far between and cannot be approached unless they come to your table, which in our case they never did. Blue Bayou and Lamplighter Lounge are fun for the atmosphere, not for the food.

Disneyland hotel is great.  But reading other reviews I agree, the cast members aren‚Äôt as nice (specifically in the park).  I think they try to force people around the parks during parade times, etc and over direct the traffic so it impacts the experience.  There were so many rides and attractions down multiple times throughout the day.  We were there for about 5 days and something was down everyday.  So we ended up having to work our schedule around the broken down rides.  One of the rides that we paid extra to ride went down, then we had to ride some crap ride instead because it went down.  And so expensive, the extra costs on food and the experiences are crazy.  I think I paid $250+ for my husband and I for world of color dessert party and a fireworks party.  It was okay, the food was just so so it was all just about the experience and views mostly.  We will come again, but it is different than it used to be.

It's very discouraging when you are handicapped and there are people with strollers taking up the space meant for handicapped people on the trams and Mickey van. It's fine if the child is handicapped or has a red tag on their wagon, but having people with REAL handicaps wait for 3 or 4 trams (like 45 min or more) just because the parents don't want to have to fold their stroller is DISGUSTING! The handicapped people should take precedence over just convenience. When will Disneyland correct this important issue??

All my life I've heard people hype Disneyland altogether, regardless of theme park location. Only last summer, as part of my travels to the LA and  San Diego region in California did I finally get to experience it myself. Booked my ticket a few weeks in advance, specifically choosing a day in the beginning of the week, figuring it might be significantly less crowded than on a weekend. However, the lines for rides were still very long, especially starting around noon time. The ticket to the park itself was already fairly expensive, even compared to other large amusement parks. That continued in the park, where I found food and souvenirs to be pretty expensive as well. I'd also hoped to see employees in Disney character costumes to take a photo with. Despite being there all day long, I did not run into one. Altogether it was still an altogether fun experience, but I personally don't understand all the hype after having visited Disneyland myself. I think I'll be fine with leaving it at this one visit, and not go again, neither to the California one nor any other
Busy because of the holiday season, but we‚Äôre still able to get on a good number of rides. Make sure to bring a portable phone charger especially if using lightning lanes passes through the app.

The last time I was at the happiest place in the world I must have been in my twenties. I wanted to share a story of one particular staff member (Chris from Star Trek) that made my day the best. I got to the front of the line but got abit scared and nervous so pulled out last minute. Chris directed my out but we got talking as to how scary the ride would be. He found my comfort level (Space Mountain) and said its not even close to that and you will love this ride, only a tiny tiny drop (more like Pirates of the Caribbean he said). It turned out to be my favourite ride and I love how he was able to compare the rides for me and just the small chat helped me so much. Chris has been working at Disney for 16 years and deserves the reconition.

Last time I came here was in 88/89, and 96 respectively. A good 27 year old break, but it still feels the same. Major changes to the parks, but the vibe remains - I felt 12 once again. Little one (daughter) enjoyed it very much. Spouse was amazed and blown away as well. The Indiana Jones ride didn‚Äôt disappoint, be it in 96 or in 2023. The extension of Disney Adventure Park is another milestone for Disney; great Pixar and Marvel extensions. The Downtown Disney District welcomes anyone before or after their adventure in either Disney parks - we were surprised at how enjoyable it was (shopping district with a little bit for everyone including kids). Holistically, it was an unforgettable experience. Please get yourself the black Sprint Jersey. It is massively comfortable.

Always an excellent time to visit but love the Christmas Holiday the best.We go in November feels a little less crowded than December and still get all the Christmas atmosphere absolutely worth it especially for a family group of 12. Plan ahead so you can pay ahead and have plenty of money to spend at the park!

There was no signage to find the shuttle from our hotel. There was no signage indicating where the lines for rides started. The Star Wars Galaxy area had no characters to get photos with. For every ride we wanted to go on, we could not find the entry point. The app was useless for trying to navigate and to order food from.  Plus, it was so crowded we could barely get through areas. I have no intentions of returning to Disney.

I spent one day in Disneyland and one day in California Adventures. Disneyland:- unbelievably crowded, especially as CA adventures closed early that day so night time was just an unsafe crush of people, particularly at the parade and fireworks. Workers constantly shuffled people along and out of places to watch the events even if they weren't in the walkway but inside the stores. People paid sooo much money to be here, you know they're going to do everything they can to watch the events that they want to watch, especially when...- the rides are broken ALL. THE. TIME. I noticed throughout the day The Mickey & Minnie Runaway Railway kept closing, so I didn't make my way over to Toontown.  tried to go to Space Mountain THREE separate times, and by the time I got there it was "temporarily closed." Splash Mountain occasionally closed. Pirates of the Caribbean broke down, etc, etc. It was so frustrating because that meant you walked all the way there and had to walk all the way back to another ride instead, such as Rise of the Resistance. Great ride, but I walked there after Space Mountain was broken (AGAIN), and was told with a too-bad shrug it closed early at 10 PM, even though the park closed at 12AM. It was literally 10:07 PM. Okay, DCA closes early, a ton of rides of broken - at least try to make it right for guests with any semblance of customer service and keep it open a tad longer? Really poorly maintained rides that make me question how safe it is.DCA:- unfortunately it rained heavily during my day here. Disney can't control the weather. What they can and should control, however, is operations when it rains. They knew the rain was coming, and didn't seem to do anything to prepare for it. Rides were closed most of the day - I'm not entirely sure why because I noticed some reopened during some of the heaviest rains. So can the rides operate in the rain or not? Or did they initially close because they were unprepared to deal with the weather? It's a mystery. - There's very little to do in DCA when there's rain, so people end up wandering around looking for places to eat or into the shops. I'm half convinced Disney purposefully kept the rides shut down longer than needed (see my comment above about it reopening during heaviest rains) to push people into spending even more money on food and merch. Truly, it wouldn't surprise me. - There is so little sense and lack of preparation for the rain that EVERYONE knew might come for at least one week. For example, I saw employees CLOSING the umbrellas over these little table stands where people would eat while it was raining. Can you please explain to me why they would do this? It's raining - there's not a ton of indoor space in DCA. Why would you purposefully want to make people more uncomfortable? Additionally, despite that it was cold and rainy, all indoor spaces were blasting drafty A/C - why? Why not adjust for what's actually happening that day? This is what I mean when I saw Disney really does not care about the customer experience.Overall, I was really surprised how the quality of customer service has declined so significantly compared to past experience when they all tried their best to be friendly and helpful. One example that encapsulates this: I asked an employee who was just standing around near the shop close to Small World to help me take a picture. He wordlessly took my phone and snapped a pic. I asked him to take just one more in another direction and he wordlessly took another photo and handed me back my phone. I said thank you and he didn't look at me or acknowledge me in any way. I actually thought he couldn't hear me because it was so strange, so I said thank you again and again he completed ignored and dismissed me. Oh, Disney, what have you become?

Our family had a horrible experience when trying to enter Disneyland California Adventure yesterday. Our tickets were purchased a few weeks in advance and when we got the order confirmation everything was in order 3 persons above 10 years and 2 persons between 3-9 years. However, the person at the gates noticed that the tickets we had showed that my wife's ticket was a kid's ticket. This was of course not what was in our order confirmation. We were told to go to the ticket office where we needed to wait in line for up to 2 hours, it was an agonizing experience for the family and the kids were very disappointed. Especially since we spent the whole day at Disneyland the day before in the rain. When we finally got to the ticket booth, the manager Steve told us that it was our fault, that we showed the wrong tickets at the gates, and we needed to pay to upgrade our tickets (!!!). We were so frustrated by this behavior from the manager, with no regard for service-mindedness at all. The day started off the wrong way since you naturally want to be treated with kindness and respect.

Attractions have poor maintenance, suddenly they stop working.After more than 90 minutes waiting you are told to leave. Waste of time. Expensive, frustrating visit. Paying a ticket just to go to walk, wait in lines for games that didn‚Äôt work. No refund issued for an expensive visit and no hames working

Came her for Halloween and was amazing as it always is. In some years past the park had been lacking in maintenance but this round as great. Even during this time it was not overly busy. I did review the places we ate and they were all great. It is easy to do this on a budget if you want to. Only issue I could say is that some rides did close down due to issues but those are the more technical ones so hopefully they fine tune them to not break as easily but aside from that everything was perfect as always. Service to food, to cleanliness everything was perfect. Staying on site does help to keep you immersed and will be going back next year for Christmas

I was here with my daughter and 3 young grandchildren. We got here at 7:45am and stayed until 8pm. During that 12 hour span, we literally got on 9 rides. The regular lines move extremely slow due to the lightening lines. Those lines take preference and are continuous. There is an extremely inequitable sharing of the line. Many times I thought the ride had broken down because we literally weren‚Äôt moving. A lot of money and energy spent on a so so day. Disappointing for sure.

Decided to take myself to Disneyland for my birthday as I have many wonderful memories of going there. Let me tell you times have changed or I have gotten so old, whatever. Thought I had planned it out as to where to go first etc etc.I guess we are old now as we found parking confusing. Have carrier on our Jeep so we were directed to the handicapped parking lot. OOOKKSecurity is tight, actually like that, did not like getting pushed to another exit and having to go thru it 3 times while there.Don't have an iphone so I guess I am in the minority as their Wifi sucks. kept dropping out. OK onwards and upwards. going straight to Star Wars was a mistake as so was everyone else. after finding most rides an hour wait we started to get selective and total for one day did 6 rides (so $20 a ride)will I go back, no. if I had grandkids, probably not unless I take a loan out and do lightning pass.Now, loved loved loved Star Wars, they have stuck money into this area and it shows. Rise of the Resistance was amazing, the hour and half wait not so much. Started doing the single rider pass as we did not want to stay until closing.again, we're old so maybe I had I expectations and good memories. Trying to get out after doing the Matterhorn was just nuts. there isn't enough money in the world to navigate a stroller here, give those parents credit tho.again would have loved to do Star Wars twice but that was on me not staying until 10pm.
The worst experience in my life. You wait forever. Can't even go on 1/4 of the things you're interested in. Everything is super expensive. At all times something you would like to ride is closed...

We went for Halloween this year and we were expecting to see more Halloween activities or decorations since it was Halloween. All the buzz was at California due to their event.  Disneyland fell short on making Halloween stand out.

So I will say - having not gone to a Disney park in about 25-30 years - I was really looking forward to this. What Disney does which is different from the other amusement parks is how well it integrates all their characters and elments into the whole experience. Most of the lines are very well designed at Disney parks, with a lot of interesting easter eggs and things to see and discover while waiting in line, which does make things more bearable when you are in there. The thought that goes into the design of these parks is really cool. The rides are less "thrilling" than other places such as Cedar Point, or Canada's Wonderland, but the whole experience is more interesting and fun. Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance is one of the best experiences I have had at an amusement park.My biggest complaint is the price gouging on literally everything - it is very unfortunate that everything is prohibitively expensive for most people, and it seems as though there are lots of people that have saved up relentlessly to be able to afford things like this. The food, the water, the merch, snacks, pictures - everything was very pricey, and not of the quality you would expect from a place like this. However, I would say that given the design of the park and all the cool things to see, this is definitely worth going to!

We visited the Disneyland park in June for 1 day as part of our LA holiday in June from the Uk. We are a family of 4 with a disabled adult as an extra member of our party.I was very impressed with the pre application for the disability pass for our party, as we had an interview over the internet to get this approved and set up. We paid extra for fast passes, but having the disability pass for our party allowed us to juggle two bookings at the same time rather than one and enabled us to do things much faster then we thought within peak time. Initially we had only booked entry to one park, but by 3pm after the parade we felt we had done all we wanted to in the original Disney park, so paid the extra to visit the California Adventure park. Disney always delivers and we had previously been to Orlando and Paris parks. The highlights were some of the things we had never experinced before, such as Indiana Jones ride, Star Wars land, Cars ride, Spiderman and the Incredicoaster. The visit was one of the highlights of our trip. A long day with great fireworks at the end and we rounded the day of with a visit to the Disney shopping village to allow the exiting crowds to die down.

The difference between Disneyland of the 1980s and 2020s is palpable.  It has become an expensive endurance test, not helped by the lack of shelter from the sun.Even with a genie+ pass and arriving for "ropes drop," we still had to queue for over an hour for our first ride.  You have to buy an additional ticket for $25 each to join the lightning lane a Rise of the Resistance. Overall - greedy, overcrowded and unpleasant.  I have no idea how people manage to do Disney with young kids!

A little disappointing. I had never been to a Disney theme park and was excited to go for the day and take my 4 year old, even though it cost a small fortune.  I‚Äôll preface my review by saying Disney World and Disneyland have always seemed overwhelming to me. Additionally, I‚Äôm not the kind of person that would be willing to stand in a line for 1-3+ hour to ride a 1-2 minute ride (craziness), not to mention able to deal with  large crowds. I choose an ‚Äúoff day‚Äù (Tuesday) and got the Genie+ pass cause I was told it would be worth it (totally wasn‚Äôt).  Used Genie + once and on a ‚Äúback up ride‚Äù when the one we choose was down. AND it kept us from being able to use Genie+ for two hours because we were on the wait for this ride we never got to ride üòí. None of the rides that I could use it on, interested my little one. The new Mickey/Minnie Runaway Train ride kept breaking down throughout the day, so never got chance to ride it (even with my Genie + pass) and that was definitely on the top of list. The two other classic rides (Space Mountain and It‚Äôs a Small world) were down for maintenance. Stood in 3 lines for 30+ minutes to be told they had broken down. Wasn‚Äôt impressed and not eager to go back. Got there at 9am and by 4pm we were both ready to get the hell out of there ( can‚Äôt believe we made it that long). Was it worth the memories (my little one didn‚Äôt seem excited about characters) or money? No. The next day we went to Pacific Park on the pier in Santa Monica and had the best time with way less stress and money, and smiles all day long.

Come on Disney.  You‚Äôre made your park experiences a joke.   You need a decider ring to figure out what‚Äôs included and what charge extra for.   Let‚Äôs start with the number of closed attractions.   You clearly realize less attractions means longer lines for the remaining factors.  No less then 5 of your mega attractions are always closed.   Now let‚Äôs get into the countless ride malfunctions.   After waiting in line or wasting hours of time on your absurd pay for play greenie pass your rides shut down with no rhyme or reason.  Worse yet, your staff doesn‚Äôt care because you don‚Äôt care and everyone walks away disappointed to even longer lines at the next attraction. Now let‚Äôs talk about this ‚Äúgeenie‚Äù trash upgrade.   First, it‚Äôs only available on certain rides and even though it‚Äôs a paid app it only works on a handful of attractions.   Did I mention there are even more ‚Äútiers‚Äù and even if you buy a multi day park hopper, pay for the upgrades, do the upgraded character meals and you still want another lighting lane fee for star wars.  No thanks.   We‚Äôve lost that magic feeling Disney.  It‚Äôs going to be a long long time before we ever even consider stepping foot in another one of your parks.  Despite our fond memories, it‚Äôs time to say adios to the former kingdom of magic.

Stepping into the park is like entering a world where all your childhood dreams come true. The rides, from classics like Space Mountain to newer additions like Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, are a total blast. And the parades and shows? They bring out the kid in everyone. Plus, the food options are diverse and delicious. It's not just an amusement park; it's a place where happiness is the main attraction. Disneyland is a must-visit for anyone looking to escape into a world of wonder and nostalgia. It's the happiest place on earth for a reason!

With the cheapest hotel rate of $800 a night, ticket prices that have gone through the roof, and unimaginably complicated reservations processes for parks and restaurants, Disneyland is becoming the least happiest place on earth. My personal phone communications with ‚ÄúCast Members‚Äù found them to be brusque, uninformed and, frankly, rude.  I believe Disney has become a little too full of itself. I doubt we will be visiting again.

My family and I are avid Fall school break goers. It‚Äôs a perfect time as the weather is great and it‚Äôs Halloweentime at the Parks! The added theme makes for a really fun time. Different treats, lots of amazing picture opportunities and characters in dress give it that extra layer of excitement.

I was only able to visit for around 4 hours however I adored this park!I have been to Florida, California and Paris, and can confidently say Hong kong is  a must visit! There are so many unique rides here. Mystic manor is hong kongs version of haunted mansion and it is the best version I have ridden! Same goes for grizzly peak (big thunder mountain. So many of the rides here have unique elements with beautiful design. The park itself is so vibrant and well designed. Frozen land is a work of art and currently a unique experience to hong kong. The park also wasn't too overcrowded. I arrived at 5pm and left at 8:30 and was able to ride 6 rides, four of which were hong kong exclusive. In this time I also did some souvenir shopping and had some snacks. Wait times were very reasonable!This is also a park which has duffy and friends who I adore. They have some of the cutest merch I have seen! I can't recommend this park enough, it is small but there is plenty to fill your time with!

Definitely it is a must to Visit Disney land when you are traveling to Hong Kong. It is our first to travel with my son and it was the best memorable experience. As he uttered ‚Äúit is the best day ever‚Äù. Truly amazing how the staffs are very accommodating , rides are spectacular and has variety of food to choose. I would definitely recommend to my family and friends.

A quick MTR ride from Hong Kong to Lantau Island this iteration of the Magic Kingdom is sized down from Anaheim or Orlando, but a good value in comparison.  Featuring some unique rides, food and Souvenirs there's easily enough to spend a day doing here.  No pirates.  No haunted mansion.  No goofy.  No pluto.  A bit too much Frozen and Marvel, and the longest line was only 35 minutes.
Minnie mouse!! cool castle!! not very crowded!! small but nostalgic!! i love hong kong disney!! BUT the parade is quite lame and short ngl. old parade was better üò©üò©

We visited HK Disneyland just before Christmas and had a fantastic day. Having visited LA, Orlando, Paris and Tokyo's parks, I can vouch that the magical atmosphere is well and truly alive at HK Disneyland.  We bought tickets online and used the Disney app to work out ride order. Midweek was not crowded - our longest queue time was 15 minutes (Space Mountain) so we were able to catch lots of rides. Food options were good. No parade, but Mickey and friends were out and about. Hats off to the Jungle Boat guide who translated the tour in 3 languages throughout the ride!

The most horrible experience.  The chinese music on Main Street is OVERWHELMINGLY LOUD. ear splitting and takes away the Disney magic. Feels like a Chinese market Disney should just do what it does best and forget about the horrible clanging Chinese music.  Totally horrible experience.  Trying to stay sane in this crazy cacophony.

Eventhough the area is bit larger than USS Singapore, I feel here is smaller just because the too crowded the people, start after lunch time.Coming here at 10am and we got special lane, since we were stay in Disneyland hotel, this is important, because you can save 30 mins if regular lane.Strong advice if you are tourist, you buy VVIP ticket for special lane for 8 riding, you will save a lot of time compared to regular lane for each riding.Lunch time need to 1 hour advance, or you will be stuck in every restaurant in Disney park.Waiting for Christmas tree show was absorbing our energy since we need to waiting 45 mins before start.As well as, we were waiting for fire work show at 9.30pm.Actually, for the show, are not too interesting. Also not too many characters surrounding in the park, so we cannot the photo, just a few of characters which are not special one.If you stay in Disneyland hotel, you will feel comfortable since no need have long trip from the park to get a rest after whole day walked for 20,000 steps.Email me if there is anything you want to know.I think enough for 1 time come here, since feel boring and not too special atmosphere.

The day was a magical as I envisaged for my daughter's 11th birthday. The only disappointment was not reaching an equitable outcome on purchased tickets for my niece and nephew that was not able to attend due to catching measles. The "no refund, no transfer" policy in this case was applied.

Bring an empty water flask to to up drinking water from the drinking water fountains. Also don't bother to bring a portable seat stool as they will have your bags checked prior to admission into the themed park. And even if you try to sneak in any items that they deem prohibited, you are allowed to keep it stored with them till 9:00pm when the park closes and you will be charged HKD$170,00 for storing  a product that  they for unexplained reasons that they deemed  "not allowed into the park". The park charges a ridiculous HKD$55 for a small bottle of Coke / Iced lemon tea / orange juice. Daylight robbery! This is our 4th visit to the park ever since 2014 and the prices have shot up but  the quality has definitely plummeted. The dining restaurant was conveniently  unable to serve ala carte meals but miraculously the much  more expensive set meals were available(?) , this would be ur final visit to any Disney 'product',  be it the theme park or  their hotels or cruises! Nothing  spoils a holiday more than the feeling of getting ripped off/ scammed , when after forking out good money for their theme park and on-site hotel rooms! BYE - BYE  DISNEY! It WAS good while it lasted but from here on, we choose to spend our good money at better locations and rival theme parks that doesn't practice dirty/ scamming tactics to their good paying customers. See ya!

It was our goal to take our 6 year old daughter and she loved every bit. We visited on the 3rd of Jan 2025 so it was extremely busy hence 1 day was not enough as we didn't get to see everything because the lines were long. For some rides we waited 60 minutes.The Stark 4d ride was the best we have been on. Also the frozen castle and ride....wowMost of all , we loved how easy it was to take the train there.We bought our tickets on Klook and it came with a lunch meal and snacks.
It was a nice atmosphere, able to complete the entire park visit in a day. Bought the deal with the meal voucher so I was able to have a meal during my visit as well, which to me seemed worth it.

I‚Äôve been to Disney in Florida, California and Paris and Hong Kong had that same feeling the others deliver‚Ä¶ a great fun day out with all that Disney magic.They offer a few different experiences such as mystic manor, grizzly gulch ( cross between thunder mountain and Everest) , etc which adds to going to a park in a different part of the world.It‚Äôs all in a wonderful location, quite unique for a Disney Park‚Ä¶ watching the sun set on top at the main entrance railroad station was exceptional. We ate at Tahitian Terrace 3 times, we found the butter chicken and the vegetarian option really good‚Ä¶. if you have a 2day ticket you get 20% off on your first day.Also we had to do the Duffy and friends meet and greets as you don‚Äôt get these in the US and Europe‚Ä¶ the Chinese go mad for these and it‚Äôs quite an experience the lengths they go to in preparing for their encounter!The stage shows were very good and it was quite easy to get a good viewing spot if you choose the quieter times of year to go‚Ä¶.. however it‚Äôs the only park I‚Äôve visited that has no parade‚Ä¶. I have to knock it down to a 4 out of 5 because of this, Disney without a parade???? It shouldn‚Äôt even be considered!

We loved our visit to Disneyland Hong Kong! It was a fun day that released our inner child. Easy to get too via MRT we enjoyed a full day walking around the park taking in the sights, enjoying the rides and taking photos/making memories. Whilst popular it wasn't too busy to enjoy. A very happy day

Amazing place to go to have a day of fun. Many restaurants and people there. It was 30 degrees Celsius when we went in March so definitely wear T-shirts. Crowd lines could be long in the morning so come early or go and wait in the line. Many good restaurants there that you can go to. Many rides too. There is a boat ride in the Tarzen area which is an amazing experience to go to. Overall, this is a good place to go to spend a day there and have fun. Highly recommend for all ages and all families.

Hong Kong Disneyland is a fun day out, no doubt about it. The park is smaller than its American counterpart, which means you can comfortably hit most of the major rides and attractions in a single day. My kids absolutely loved the Mystic Manor ride ‚Äì it's a unique and genuinely thrilling experience that's unlike anything I've seen in other Disney parks. The parades are also fantastic, full of vibrant colours and energy, and the characters are always happy to pose for photos. I'd recommend booking your tickets in advance, especially if you're visiting during a busy period.

A couple of tips:1. Plan to visit on xmas day. I know, this tip is a little too late (this year). But a couple of people told us last year that xmas day was the best day to visit because it's not a mainland China holiday and for a lot of other families they'll be opening presents at home. We waited a whole year to come on xmas day. It's true, the crowds were definitely less!2. Get the Early Entry Pass, which lets you into the park an hour before the general public admission. The Early Entry Pass (HK$199) is such a great deal compared to the '8 Attraction Premier Pass' (HK$529).3. Get there early for 'rope drop'. If you don't know what 'rope drop' means, google it! The park opens at 10am. Your early pass lets you in at 9am. Get there for 8:30-8:40am-ish, get through the first bag check area, there will already be a queue forming at the entry gate.4. 9am, the park opens, run or walk briskly to get to Frozen land! Some say it is the only part of the park open from 9-10AM. I am not sure whether this is true, though I do know many rides only open at 10am elsewhere in the park. And going to Frozen land is why you probably got the early entry pass anyway! We got there at 9:10AM, right away did the Frozen Ever After boat ride, then the Wandering Oaken's Sliding Sleights, then the Frozen Ever After boat ride again, all before 9:40am.5. Then start moving onto your next popular ride in another area of the park. Check the time for the ride open, a lot of them open at 10AM. We got to Tomorrowland at 10AM and did Ant Man & the Wasp and the Ironman experience before 10:20AM.6. After this, you'll probably be able to do a couple more rides in other places you want in the park, all without line-ups, because everyone else who has just got to the park is probably headed to Frozen land or Tomorrowland. Basically you'll always be one step ahead of everyone else!7. Some say night times at Disneyland are the best. We were exhausted by 2pm! Consider staying at one of the Disneyland hotels, or one of the nearby Tung Chung hotels, where you can have a nap/shower in the early afternoon, and head back to Disneyland in the early evening. Once again you'll probably find less crowds, less lines, and you'll get to enjoy the fireworks! 8. So you probably didn't even need the Premier Access pass! Well, if you're rich it's nice to have some optionality, like if you wanted to go to Mystic Manor at some point during the day. You'll also find there are some kiddie rides that aren't covered by the 8 Attraction Pass, I suppose you could pay for these individual cut-the-queue passes on demand during the day (there will be a sign or separate queue for these).9. 'Playhouse in the Woods' ($129) was cheap but totally not worth it. It's a big group and you don't really get to interact with the princesses.Have fun!!

Visiting  Disneyland Hongkong is always fun and memorable. This was our 2 nd visit and with lots of new rides it was a fun filled day for us Try to visit on a weekday as tickets are cheaper. If you are going on a weekend then I suggest take the early entry tickets and finish the new Frozen world first followed by Toy story worldVegetarian people plz carry food as there are no veg options available, not even pizza. Not a very big park , 1 day is enough You can reach easily by the metro.

Unfortunately my least-enjoyable Disneyland experience so far. This experience at Disneyland Hong Kong just felt different from prior experiences elsewhere."Anarchy" is one word that constantly popped up in my mind over the 2 days my family and I were here.From the moment we boarded the train to get to the park, the experience alternated between Disney's fairy tale characters and Lord of the Ring's hordes of orcs.On both mornings, we arrived at the gates at 9:50am, and ended up entering the park at about 10:45am.For whatever reason, the majority of the park's patrons consistently demonstrated blatant disregard for:1. Queues2. Personal space3. Social etiquettes4. Rules5. Even safety reminders.Shoving, rushing, and shouting was a very big part of the experience throughout those 2 days. Anarchy and chaos was a constant theme. We witnessed several shouting matches between patrons, and even a couple of physical fights. Families with young children or elderly folks would certainly be preyed on, as we repeatedly witnessed.One had to be constantly alert and hold their ground quite literally. A momentary lapse in concentration while standing in line could, and would, cause one to lose one's spot in the queues, as people behind in the queue would take every opportunity to unapologetically skip ahead whenever an opportunity arose. There also appeared to be an unwritten understanding that the closer everyone got to the person in front while queuing, the quicker the line would move. Bonus points for touching the backs of people immediately ahead in the queue, or breathing down their necks - literally.In relation to points #4 and #5 above, do also expect disruptions to rides thanks to people who refuse to abide by safety rules and try to argue their way out of compliance.Mealtimes are like frenzies. As there are no queues for table allocations, securing a table requires some combination of deft footwork, lightning reflexes, and thick skin. In some situations, strong core and shoulder muscles, conspicuously large bicep muscles, and a loud voice might also provide an added advantage.We consumed about 5 meals in total over both days in the park, and in all 5 experiences, we spent more time standing in whatever semblance of a queue there was to purchase food, than actually consuming the food.We also made 4 attempts to purchase souvenirs at the gift shops. We aborted 2 of those attempts due to overcrowding in the shops.Around the park, most of the staff had given up any effort to try to be friendly or, in some instances, even polite (especially at the F&B outlets). Many also gave up trying to enforce queues or rules. Most of them looked jaded, some even traumatised.That said, while these are the main differences between Disneyland HK vs Disneyland in many other parts of the world, there are still some enjoyable bits to the experiences. The rides and performances were mostly of good quality, as can be expected of Disney.There was something disappointing though - no street parade in Disneyland?

We visited Disneyland as part of our trip to HK in June 2024. Disneyland itself doesn't need an introduction as it is one of the happening theme parks for all aged travellers. Yes, but be prepared to walk for long and select rides before going to avoid rush and missing the rides by the end of day. We did all the thrill rides.
A fun day was had by all, the park is small enough to be enjoyed by even the youngest members of the family. Its not a massive thrill seeking Disney where rides are concerned.

The best place to spend the day with your family, friends, and relatives.  I enjoyed all the roller-coaster rides,  The jungle river tour, and almost everything in HK Disneyland.  As if, I become a child again mingling with Mickey Mouse, Seeing Pocahontas and more Disney characters.  Amazing fireworks and everything's so beautiful.

Super disappointed. US traveler who‚Äôs been to both Disneyworld and Disneyland. Expectation was high delivery poor. Very small compared to Disneys back home. All outdoor rides closed due to pending typhoon which never remotely  materialized nor did a single raindrop fall. Entrance fee was $95/person. They had a less than G rated version of the  of Pirates of the Caribbean,  some little kiddie version. And the finale, if you could call it that was a 10 minute parade with one float, no fireworks. The only way this would be remotely worth it is if you had little children. Otherwise save your money for another excursion.

Choosing the early entry pass was a game-changer for us! We managed to experience all the rides in the park within just half a day‚Äîno fast pass needed! We even caught every show on our list. A little tip: head to the Frozen section first; it really helps you save time for everything else, allowing you to plan your day around the shows. It was such an epic experience!

As a HUGE fan of Disney, I visit Disneyland every time I travel. I have been to Disney Land all over the world, but honestly it's hard to say this one is the best. It is only a quarter size of Tokyo Disney land and it wasn't that interesting compared to the one in Tokyo.But it was still the best!

Hong Kong Disneyland is a unique park but still uniquely Disney. It wasn‚Äôt our favourite Park (we are visiting every Park around the world and have done Euro Disney and the Parks in California and Florida) but there was still so many positives. The biggest of which was the package rates you can find which for us included a 2 day ticket and 2 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel and how quiet the park can be. We didn‚Äôt experience anything more than a 20 minute queue during our visit and got everything done in one day we didn‚Äôt bother visiting for a 2nd day. The park itself seems smaller than other parks but there are a lot of empty wide spaces with just nothing there with many of the food vendors not open until later in the day. We still enjoyed our day and every part of it still felt like ‚ÄòDisney‚Äô. You will still find the classic rides that you get at every park but some unique attractions to Hong Kong like the Iron Man & Ant Man and the Wasp ride. There was no big parade during our visit just a very small train with some characters thereon but still character interactions throughout the park. Momentous night time show was brilliant. On that note the Disney Premiere Access (DPA) including Monemtous was worth it as we got access to the front of the castle to watch the show. Early entry which we also paid extra for wasn‚Äôt worth it as only the world of Frozen area was open & we had a couple of fast passes for the two rides available in that area anyway which we didn‚Äôt end up using since the queue times was only 5 minutes during the early entry time.
Hong Kong Disneyland offers a magical experience with fun rides, charming parades, and iconic characters. Perfect for families, it's a compact, enjoyable park for all ages.

A small but very cozy park with unique attractions. We never had to wait longer than 10 minutes and the weather was beautiful. Unfortunately there was no parade and no show in the Aventureland theater, but we knew this in advance. We had a delicious meal and the employees were generally very friendly.
Hong Kong Disneyland offers a magical experience for all ages with exciting rides, enchanting shows, and Disney-themed attractions. A must-visit for family fun!

Before my visit, I had low expectations because everyone kept telling me that this Disneyland couldn't be compared to the others I had visited before, mainly due to its smaller size.I went on a weekday, which meant it was much less crowded. Thanks to the app, we monitored queue times extensively, allowing us to enjoy more rides in the park.Regarding the park's size, I actually liked it! Instead of taking a long walk between different themes and rides, everything was just around the corner. I think this is a bonus when traveling with young kids.The only downside, which is common in every Disneyland, is the very long waiting time to take pictures with the Disney characters. The wait was about 1.5 hours, which is nearly impossible with kids. I truly hope Disney considers using technology to help reduce the queuing time.

Out of all the Disney parks I have been to, this was the most disappointing. Pros: very little wait at any ride or experience. No need to buy the extra pass. Smaller park so walking the whole thing is very manageable. Cons: the staff does not really love working there lol. Which I understand! But also does not contribute to the Disney experience. Gluten free is an anomaly. I did have a good lunch at Magellan‚Äôs but they had to prepare a main course for me specifically. None of the other food was gluten free.

It was our second visit to this place since my daughter wanted to see it again after 7 years.  The place is beautiful but I think it's overrated.  The rides will take you a minimum of 30 minutes waiting time before you can try one...Nothing much had changed since our visit in 2017.  The restaurants and coffee shops are all overpriced as well as the souvenirs.  You are lucky to get a chance to even get a photo taken with their live Disney characters and the waiting time to see one is too long.  I guess that would be my last visit to this place.

If I were to compare this to the other Disney resorts around the world, I‚Äôd probably go to a 4* but based on this trip I really enjoyed this park as a standalone and it had a charm the other parks can‚Äôt match.The setting for this park is just beautiful, it‚Äôs really secluded and can‚Äôt be seen from anywhere so immediately upon arriving you feel like you are entering into a complete fantasy world.The attractions here are great fun too. You‚Äôve got the superb Mystic Manor which is unique and the Ant Man dark ride was one of the surprise hits.Like all other Disney parks, this has the night time spectacular in the form of Momentous which as expected, is an absolute delight.The park is the smallest of all Magic Kingdoms and on the day we went queues and crowds were low so a one-day ticket was more than adequate.Give it a go, it‚Äôs a great little park!

Just wanted to give a BIG SHOUT OUT "THANK YOU CODY" It has been two weeks now since we were at Hong Kong Disneyland and still remember what a professional person Cody was. Cody served us on our way out after a very enjoyable, exhausting day. We were extremely tired and Cody was the most pleasant, professional person to deal with Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!People like yourself even though it's very brief is what makes our holiday perfect.

Disneyland Hong Kong might be smaller than its American counterpart but nevertheless it offers a fun day out on a visit to Hong Kong. Easily accessible by metro (change at Sunny Bay for the Disneyland Line, a dedicated Disney-themed train stopping a short distance from the entrance to the park), we had the bonus going at this time of the year to enjoy the Halloween theme throughout the park and the parade. Plenty of souvenir shops along the main street and good choices of places for eating (although as expected a bit pricey). A lot of visitors like to dress up cosplay style and it added to the festive and pleasant atmosphere of the park. Lots of rides for all ages but one particular area that stood out for us was Frozen World with rides and the attention to details on the buildings in the village really good. Plenty of Disney characters to meet and not to be missed are the parade and of course the spectacular show against the castle background at closing time. Overall I would recommended to everyone to escape the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong for a day.

Hong Kong Disneyland is located on Lantau Island, away from the population center of Hong Kong, but it is conveniently connected via MTR that drops the visitors directly at the entrance.  And just like other Disneyland resorts, you are greeted by the Main Street upon entry, and beyond that, the Disney castle, with all the other theme-based attractions scattered around the periphery.  If you have visited other Disneyland resorts before, the Hong Kong version will not disappoint.

We love the detail from Disneyland Hongkong , A good trips for travel in Hongkong , too much the poetic architecture reminds me of my own childhood. The most special was the Frozen tour, the princess Elsa model was really impressive, an experience that surprised me, I imagined I was in that world. Highly recommend when we visit hongkong

We visited the new Frozen experience. The Frozen ride was fantastic. And the other experiences were the typical Disney quality like the Ironman and Ant Man rides. For Americans, we were surprised that adults are allowed to cosplay the Disney characters at this Disneyland.  We almost approached someone walking all dressed up as a Disney character for picture and found out she was only a guest.  We are glad we chose a Disney resort hotel where we were able to take photos with characters with dining.The bathrooms at the end of the day were not maintained well, specially as we noticed people leaving their kids soiled diapers open in the trash. The culture with lines is very obtrusive. There is no much sense of personal space. People were not very courteous when they walk they just cut pass you.I‚Äôve been to both parks in the US and also in Tokyo. This one is at the bottom of my list. I will not go back to this one. The resort experience at the hotel was great. I will stay there again if I come back and maybe tour the city instead.

We came to Disney with our 4 year old daughter as we‚Äôve been to Paris with her and she‚Äôs a typical Disney fan. Firstly we went on a Friday which we thought may be less busy but it was very crowded from the beginning. The one train is crammed with people and then it‚Äôs a push and shove to get out. There were several times in the day when I‚Äôm sure there would be a crushing accident with the amount of people all trying to get through. Lots of Q jumpers but the staff are looking for it and appear to be fair to others. The day we went it was 31 degrees and it is hard when you are queuing in the mid day sun with no shade or fans etc. we ended up having to shade ourselves for a few hours just so we weren‚Äôt in the midday sun for too long. I know it‚Äôs to be expected but the ride queues were all over 45 mins which makes it difficult when it‚Äôs so hot and you have to entertain young children. However the variety of rides were good and I think it‚Äôs perfect for young children as they can go on pretty much everything if they are over 102cm and enjoy the rides. Only one huge rollercoaster and ride that requires 120cm. Not many meet and greets which is a shame. All the staff were friendly and spoke English which was helpful. Food is very expensive in the park, much more than other Disney parks and it took an hour for 2 coffees to arrive in Starbucks which was frustrating. The crowds and the huge amount of people was frustrated. People really don‚Äôt care about space or order which when it‚Äôs hot is frustrating. Overall it was a lovely day, the frozen world is brilliant and all the rides we went on were good for young children. I do believe there needs to be more contingencies for the hotter weather. Considering Disney world in Florida seem to do much better, I think this is something that can be invested in.

Our family trip to Hong Kong Disneyland was nothing short of magical! From the moment we entered the park, we were immersed in a world of wonder and excitement that kept us entertained throughout the day.Arrival and First ImpressionsAs we arrived at the park, the excitement was palpable. The iconic Disney castle greeted us, and we couldn't help but snap a few family photos in front of it. The vibrant colors and cheerful music set a joyful tone for our day, instantly putting us in the Disney spirit.Attractions and RidesWe started our adventure with some classic attractions. The Mystic Manor was a family favorite, offering a unique take on the traditional haunted house ride with stunning visuals and a captivating story. My kids were enthralled, and we all enjoyed the whimsical experience.We also made sure to ride Big Grizzly Mountain Runaway Mine Cars, which was an exhilarating roller coaster that provided plenty of thrills. The combination of sharp turns and breathtaking views of the park made it a highlight for everyone.The It's a Small World ride was another must-do, and it was lovely to see the smiling faces of children from around the world represented in the colorful displays. It sparked conversations about different cultures and traditions, making it an educational experience as well.Meeting CharactersOne of the most magical moments was when we met some of our favorite Disney characters. The kids were overjoyed to pose with Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse, and seeing their faces light up was priceless. The character interactions were genuine, and the staff took their time to ensure everyone had a memorable experience.Dining and SnacksAs lunchtime approached, we found a cozy spot for a meal at Royal Banquet Hall. The themed decor and delicious food options made it a great place to recharge. We indulged in some classic Disney snacks, including popcorn and churros, which added to the festive atmosphere. The kids particularly loved the character-themed treats!Parades and ShowsIn the afternoon, we caught the Disney Paint the Night Parade. The colorful floats and lively performances were mesmerizing. It was a treat to see all the beloved characters come to life in such a vibrant display. The evening ended with the spectacular Disney fireworks show over the castle, which was the perfect way to conclude our day.ConclusionOur family day at Hong Kong Disneyland was a delightful experience filled with laughter, adventure, and unforgettable memories. The park‚Äôs blend of classic Disney magic and unique attractions made it a perfect destination for all ages. We left with hearts full of joy and a strong desire to return. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to create magical moments with your family, Hong Kong Disneyland is an absolute must-visit!

A wonderful Disney experience. Unfortunately it was raining so a few of the daytime shows were cancelled when I attended but the night show lives up to its name, spectacular! Just make sure you get a good spot early to get the best view of the show.  I plan on doing all of the Disney parks one day but so far Hong Kong Disney outranks Paris in my opinion
